content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-024-24-A |Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy. |Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy. |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the work-up for fever during pregnancy |Description=Biologies and complementary examinations according to clinical examination |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle |Order=24}} In all cases, we will carry out : - ECBU - ''NFS - CRP - blood cultures (if fever > 38.5°C with search for Listeria M) - serologies according to context (rubella, toxoplasmosis, hepatitis, CMV, HIV, PB19) - Others according to signs of orientation: PCR (COVID), rapid influenza test, streto test, etc. - RCF and tocometry - obstetrical ultrasound: EPF, foetal well-being and amount of LA. question.question: What is the initial diagnostic workup for fever during pregnancy according to the provided educational content?
question.option_b: Blood cultures if fever > 38.5°C and search for Listeria monocytogenes
question.option_d: Obstetrical ultrasound for epf and foetal well-being
